question: Karyotype of Complete mole is?
exp: ANSWER: (B) 46XXREF: Dutta 6th ed p. 201Repeat in December 2011See APPENDIX-63 for "COMPLETE AND PARTIAL HYDATIDIFORM MOLES" APPENDIX - 63Complete and Partial Hydatidiform Moles:FeaturePartial Hydatidiform MoleComplete Hydatidiform MoleKaryotype69XXY, Triploid, paternal and maternal origin46XX, Diploid, mostly paternal originImmunohistochemistryhCGWeakStrongPlacental alkaline phosphataseStrongWeakhPLvariableWeakPathology Fetus or amnion, fetal vessels Hydropic villiTrophoblastic proliferationPresentVariable, often focal FocalAbsentPronounced, generalizedVariable, often markedClinical Mole clinical diagnosisUterus large for datesMalignant sequelaeRareRare<5%Common30%-50%6%-36%

question: Turner syndrome is
exp: Ans. (a) 45 XORef: Shaws 15th ed. H10-111; Harrison 19/e 635; William's Gynecology Ch 16

question: In Down's syndrome, 2nd trimester quadruple test includes all EXCEPT:
exp: Ans. (d) PAPP* The triple test measures the following three levels in the maternal serum: (sensitivity 71%)# Alpha-fetoprotein (AFP)# Human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG)# Unconjugated estriol (UE3)* Quadruple test include: triple test + Inhibin A: increases sensitivity upto 80%The levels may indicate increased risk for certain conditions: hCGAssociated conditionsLowLowHighDown's syndromeLowLowLowTrisomy 18 (Edward's syndrome)High--NTD, omphalocoele, gastrochisis

question: Treatment of hydatiform mole is -
exp: Ans. is 'd' i.e., Suction and Evacuation Managem_entof Hydatid.iform mole:o Suction evacuation (SE) is the prefered method of treatment. It is safe, rapid and effective in almost all cases. Suction evacuation can safely be done even when the uterus is of 28 weeks of gestation.

question: Quadruple test is used for-
exp: Ans. is 'a' i.e., Down's syndrome Tests used to detect Down .v syndrome ftrisomies)o "Triple test(MSAFP, UE3, total hCG)o Quadruple test(MSAFP, UE3, total hCG & Inhibin A)

question: Which of the following is true about Turner syndrome:
exp: Ans. (d) All of the aboveRef : Shaws 15th ed. /110-111, Harrison 19/e 635; D.C Dutta 6th Ed. 1422-423In turner syndrome* Deletion of genetic material from an X chromosome accounts for about two thirds of gonadal dysgenesis which leads to a condition called turner syndrome (XO).* A 45, X karyotype is found in about half of these patients, most of whom have associated somatic defects including short stature, webbed neck, low hairline, shield-shaped chest, widening of long bones, STREAK GONADS, renal anomalies (Horse-shoe kidney) and cardiovascular defects (COA).* Other features of turners syndrome is summarized in the image given.

question: Which of the following is bad prognostic factor for choriocarcinoma?
exp: ANSWER: (A) Full term pregnancyREF: COGDT 10th ed p. 892, Novak's 14th ed p. 1593PROGNOSTIC FACTORS OF CHORIOCARCINOMAGood prognostic factorsBad prognostic factorsShort duration < 4 monthsSerum beta HCG < 40,000 m IU/ mlNo metastasis to brain or liverNo significant prior to chemotherapyLong duration > 4 monthsSerum beta HCG > 40,000 m IU/ mlMetastasis to liver or liverUnsuccessful prior chemotherapyAfter full term pregnancy

question: In turner syndrome all are seen EXCEPT:
exp: Ans. question: Treatment for a 16 weeks hydatiform mole is?
exp: ANSWER: (B) Suction evacuationREF: Dutta 6th ed p. 198The treatment of choice for H.mole in uncomplicated cases is suction evacuation.

question: Karyotype of partial mole is:
exp: Ans: b (69 XXY) Ref: Shaw, 13th ed, p. 250The partial mole demonstrates triploid karyotype (69 chromosomes) where as a complete mole is composed of 46 XX and all chromosomes are of paternal origin. This is called androgenesis. The pattern 46XY is infrequent.46 XX - empty ovum fertilized by haploid sperm which duplicates after meiosis.46 XY - two sperms fertilize an empty ovum.FeatureComplete molePartial moleKaryotype46, XX (46,XY)Triploid 69, XXYVillous edemaAll villiSome villiTrophoblast proliferationDiffuse; circumferentialFocal; slightAtypiaOften presentAbsentSerum hCGElevatedLess elevatedhCG in tissue+++++Behaviour2% chorio carcinomaRare choriocarcinoma

question: 29 years female, G2 P1A1 with 16 weeks amenorrhoea, lower abdominal pain and vaginal bleeding, ultrasonography shows snow storm appearance. What is the most feasible method of treatment-
exp: Ans. is 'd' i.e., Suction evacuation o 29 yrs female with amenorrohea of 16 weeks with lower abdominal pain and vaginal bleeding and snow storm appearance on usg gives us a diagnosis of kydatidiform mole.o The most preferred definitive treatment in case of hvdatidiform mole in almost all cases is suction evacuation.It can be easily done upto 28 weeks of gestation.In favourable cervix suction evacuation is done with a negative pressure of200 - 250 mm Hg. F the cervix is closed prior dilatation is followed by suction and evacuation.

question: Most common site of metastasis in Choriocarcinoma is?
exp: ANSWER: (B) LungsREF: Shaw 14th e p- 233Sites of metastasis in choriocarcinomaLungs (80%) > vagina (30%) > pelvis (20%) > liver (10%) > brain (10%)

question: Snow storm appearance on IJSG seen in:
exp: Ans: A (Hydatiform mole) "Sonography: Characteristic echogram of molar pregnancy is snowstorm appearance"- Dutta Obstetrics 6th/196Also know"The ultrasound appearances of testicular microlithiasis: 'SnowStorm' testis- www.bjm.org/cgi"Sonographic appearances in neonates with generalized meconium peritonitis: the snowstorm sign"-http://b}r.birjournals. org /cgi/reprint/57/6 76/340.pdf
